description:
Async programming can make complex things easy, but at the same time be
hard to get 100% correct; particularly when it comes to exceptions and
handling states outside the "happy path". Python has been gaining tools
to more easily handle the failure cases, notably in 3.11 a new exception
handling syntax: ``except*``.

Don't know what this does or how to read it? This talk is for you.

This talk will briefly discuss asyncio and how async code differs from
normal functions, ``TaskGroups`` and when to use them, and finally
``ExceptionGroups`` and the ``try: except*:`` syntax.
title: How Many Times Can One Line Fail? ExceptionGroups & Except*: What They Are and How to Use Them
